tell-me-strength.context: Delilah asks Samson to reveal the secret of his strength for the first time.
tell-me-strength.hebrew: הַגִּידָה־נָּא לִי בַּמֶּה כֹּחֲךָ גָּדוֹל וּבַמֶּה יֵאָסֵר לְעַנֹּותֶךָ
tell-me-strength.english: Tell me, please, where your great strength lies, and with what you may be bound to afflict you.

bound-with-cords.context: Delilah, after being lied to, questions Samson again.
bound-with-cords.hebrew: אִם־יֵאָסְרוּנִי בַּעֲבֹתִים חֲדָשִׁים אֲשֶׁר לֹא־נַעֲשָׂה בָהֶם מְלָאכָה וְחָלִיתִי וְהָיִיתִי כְּאַחַד הָאָדָם
bound-with-cords.english: If they bind me securely with new ropes that have never been used, then I shall become weak and be like any other man.

seven-locks.context: Delilah continues to press Samson for the truth.
seven-locks.hebrew: הֶאָחִי תְּעַתֶּה בִּי וּתְדַבֵּר אֵלַי כְזָבִים הַגִּידָה־נָּא לִי בַּמֶּה תֵּאָסֵר
seven-locks.english: Until now you have mocked me and told me lies. Tell me now how you might be bound.

hair-shaved.context: Samson finally reveals the truth about his hair.
hair-shaved.hebrew: מוֹרָה לֹא־עָלָה עַל־רֹאשִׁי כִּי־נְזִיר אֱלֹהִים אֲנִי מִבֶּטֶן אִמִּי אִם־אֶגָּלַח וְסָר מִמֶּנִּי כֹּחִי וְחָלִיתִי וְהָיִיתִי כְּכָל־הָאָדָם
hair-shaved.english: No razor has ever come upon my head, for I have been a Nazirite to God from my mother’s womb. If I am shaved, then my strength will leave me, and I shall become weak and be like any other man.

philistines-are-upon-you.context: Delilah calls out to Samson after cutting his hair.
philistines-are-upon-you.english: The Philistines are upon you, Samson!
